intro: Galactodendrum utile, commonly known as the milk bush, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and its ability to produce a milky sap, which is the source of its common name. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is often found in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple and opposite, while its stems are often woody and branched. The plant is notable for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural latex.
